args:
On a night of the Frostwyrm, when the waning
moon grins, I will descend upon the Lobel Art
Museum to claim the painting ＂The Smiling Lady.＂
—The Blue Rose
The Blue Rose is here, just as she said!
The lights were out for just a moment,\nbut she still managed to make off with\n＂The Smiling Lady.＂ Damn it all!
She can't have gone far! Find her!
Sacrebleu, am I surrounded?\nNot bad, gentlemen. Not bad at all.
You're cornered, phantom thief! Now just\nhand over the painting nice and easy.
Non, but I cannot. Treasures must be\ndelivered to their rightful places; this is\nthe only way they can truly shine.
Ha! And where exactly would that be,\nyou arrogant thief? Your bulging coffers?!
Ah, but arrogance has such a bad name.\nOne must believe in oneself if you wish to\nmake the impossible possible, non?
And with that, au revoir, everyone!
Damn! How could we let her escape?!
Rumors abound about the phantom thief Lapis.\nAlso known as the Blue Rose, she is currently \nterrorizing all of South Grastaea.

Some say she can disguise herself as anyone—
man or woman, young or old—while others claim
her true identity is that of a certain songstress.
But regardless of rumor, one thing is certain...
＂The Smiling Lady＂ is the crown jewel of \nour exhibit, and this museum is doomed\nwithout it!
D-Director, look! The painting is back!
Goodness! That's ＂The Smiling Lady,＂\nand no mistake. But when did she...?
Perhaps the rumor is true that the Blue\nRose always returns what she takes.
Well, that's convenient for us. But if so,\nwhat point is there to her thievery?
An antique shop in the poorer quarter of town\nOne of Lapis's hideouts
Do consider coming in the front door\none of these days, apprentice.
Do not call me that, if you please.\nI am the Blue Rose now.
Well, you still look a bit green to me.\nNow then, how did your little errand\nat the museum go?
＂The Smiling Lady＂ is back where she \nbelongs—or rather, your forgery of her.
Your work is truly legendary. The staff has\nno idea it is a fake, and the museum will\ndoubtless continue to turn a profit.
Flattery will at best net you a cup of tea.\n...Now then, what of the real thing?\nDid you give it to its ＂true＂ owner?
They were so happy to see their mother's\nmemento again, they wept. It was lovely.

After that painting was stolen by bandits,
it was fenced so many times that the
museum did not even realize it was
purchasing stolen property.

Unless you've got some sort of official
documentation, it's hard to prove it's yours.
Normally the owner would have been
out of luck.
But we make our own luck.
We stand up for those who have been\nrobbed, extorted, or swindled and take\nback what is rightfully theirs.
That is the duty of the Blue Rose,\nwhich has been passed down to me.
You've a way with words, I'll give you that.\nBut I wonder if you've really absorbed\nwhat that duty means.

The old Blue Rose never sent advanced
warning like you do; they simply swapped
the fakes with the real thing without
anyone knowing they'd been robbed.

Making a big production out of things
doesn't sit right with me. Perhaps you're
just too used to the spotlight, what with
your being a performer and all.
Those proclamations are bait. If it's known\nthe Blue Rose is still active, it might just\ndraw ＂them＂ out...
Which is how we will find our bitter\nenemies, Noir Magazin!
Just mind you don't get swallowed up\nalong with your bait, my dear.
By the way, I've some info for you:\nHave you heard of a nouveau riche\nby the name of Radelle?
Of the Radelle Corporation? Of course. \nThey've become quite the player of late.
There's an abandoned mine in back of \nRadelle's mansion that's been attracting\nquite the band of unsavory characters.
So small-time hoodlums are using tunnels\nas a hangout? Not so out of the ordinary.
Perhaps not a hangout, but an entrance?\nRumor is, those old tunnels lead directly\ninto the Radelle residence.
These hoodlums have been seen taking\nvaluables into the tunnels, and I doubt\nthey came by them legitimately.
Then you think Radelle is behind it?
Radelle could be a broker, or running\nsome kind of black-market auction.
A black-market auction? Like my parents...
Merci, but that WAS valuable info.\nI'll look into it at once.
Goes without saying, but I'll say it:\nDon't take any chances, apprentice.
So the rumors were true—these tunnels\nDO lead straight into the mansion!
If I can find a room full of stolen goods,\nthat will seal it.
*yawn* You know, when they said all we\nhad to do was guard a room, I thought we\ngot off easy, but I'm falling asleep here.
Hey, get it together!\nIf Radelle saw you now...
M-Mr. Radelle! We didn't realize\nyou were still up, sir!

When you're in my employ, I expect you to
earn your pay. If you find yourself weary,
I suggest you douse yourself with cold
water to keep your attention firm.
Hmm. This is locked up tight.\nBut not too tight for me...
Mon dieu! Look at all the valuables!
It will take some doing to get all of these\nout of here, so best to call it a night...\nBut first, a note!
Bonsoir, mademoiselle. I am the one\nwho makes the impossible possible:\nthe phantom thief Lapis!
Why would a phantom thief be anywhere?\nThe treasures in this room are so lovely\nI can scarce catch my breath.
So you're not working for that man?\nIn that case...
Steal me away from this place!
Never been asked to steal a person before,\nbut très bien...
Well now, isn't this exciting? Why don't\nyou take a moment and fill me in on\nyour entire story, my dear?
